importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of Doug Martin's death, October 19, 2025, marks a significant moment in sports history, prompting public mourning and media coverage of a prominent former NFL player's passing.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period from 2012 to 2015 highlights Doug Martin's peak performance in the NFL, including his Pro Bowl selections and All-Pro honors, which are critical to understanding his legacy and impact on the game.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36.
Martin was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL Draft after a standout college career at Boise State.
He rushed for 5,356 yards and 30 touchdowns over seven seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders.
Martin earned a Pro Bowl berth in his rookie season (2012) and again in 2015, and was named first-team All-Pro in 2015.
He also had 148 catches for 1,207 yards and two touchdowns.
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers issued a statement expressing deep sorrow over his passing and acknowledging his lasting impact on the franchise.
Martin was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers franchise history during the teamâ€™s 50th anniversary celebration.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36. He was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL Draft after an outstanding college career at Boise State, where he earned a Pro Bowl berth as a rookie and was named first-team All-Pro in 2015. Over his professional career, he amassed 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns, along with 148 receptions for 1,207 yards. His legacy is solidified through his recognition as one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers franchise history during their 50th-anniversary celebration. The team and his family expressed deep sorrow over his sudden and unexpected passing, which has drawn widespread attention in the sports community.
title: Former Buccaneers All-Pro Running Back Doug Martin Dies at 36
